articles.headline: After an Era of Ups and Downs, Home Prices Return to Sanity
articles.snippet: The housing market in much of the nation seems to be in a Goldilocks moment, neither too hot nor too cold, with low mortgage rates an added bonus.
articles.abstract: The housing market in much of the nation seems to be in a Goldilocks moment, neither too hot nor too cold, with low mortgage rates an added bonus.
articles.lead_paragraph: WESLEY CHAPEL, Fla. — Donte and Anjoli Hill postponed their honeymoon indefinitely and squirreled away cash wedding gifts in order to afford the down payment on the four-bedroom house they bought a few months ago in this Tampa suburb.

articles.headline: Fed, in Shift, Expects Slower Increase in Interest Rates
articles.snippet: Officials also reduced their economic forecasts during the current year, anticipating growth between 1.8 and 2 percent.
articles.abstract: Officials also reduced their economic forecasts during the current year, anticipating growth between 1.8 and 2 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The era of easy money is not ending yet.

articles.headline: Brian Williams to Stay at NBC, but Not as News Anchor
articles.snippet: The network is expected to announce that Mr. Williams will move to a new role primarily at MSNBC, probably in a breaking-news capacity.
articles.abstract: The network is expected to announce that Mr. Williams will move to a new role primarily at MSNBC, probably in a breaking-news capacity.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC is planning to announce on Thursday that Brian Williams will not return to his position as the anchor of its “Nightly News” show, four months after the network suspended him for exaggerating his experiences during a helicopter attack in Iraq, according to two people briefed on the decision.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel, John Koblin and Ravi Somaiya

articles.headline: 60 Million People Fleeing Chaotic Lands, U.N. Says
articles.snippet: The United Nations refugee agency finds that war and persecution have displaced a record number of people.
articles.abstract: The United Nations refugee agency finds that war and persecution have displaced a record number of people.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — Nearly 60 million people have been driven from their homes by war and persecution, an unprecedented global exodus that has burdened fragile countries with waves of newcomers and littered deserts and seas with the bodies of those who died trying to reach safety.

articles.headline: Church Massacre Suspect Held as Charleston Grieves
articles.snippet: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed.
articles.abstract: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — The mass murder of nine people who gathered Wednesday night for Bible study at a landmark black church has shaken a city whose history from slavery to the Civil War to the present is inseparable from the nation’s anguished struggle with race.
articles.byline: By Nick Corasaniti, Richard Pérez-Peña and Lizette Alvarez

articles.headline: In Eurozone, Growing Support for a Greek Exit
articles.snippet: Economists and government officials in Europe have begun to accept that little more is to be gained in this struggle to get Greece to play by the rules.
articles.abstract: Economists and government officials in Europe have begun to accept that little more is to be gained in this struggle to get Greece to play by the rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: Of the countless writs and regulations that govern Europe’s currency club, one golden rule trumps them all: Membership is conditional.
